# Track Distribution Status and Delivery

After sending your press release, you can track in real-time how many emails were delivered, who opened them, and which links were clicked.

## Why is Tracking Important?

**Measure Success:**
- How many journalists actually received the email?
- How many opened it?
- Which links were clicked?

**Identify Problems:**
- High bounce rate â†’ Outdated contacts in CRM
- Low open rate â†’ Emails land in spam
- Many unsubscribes â†’ Content not relevant

**Optimize Distribution:**
- Identify engaged journalists (often open/click)
- Remove inactive contacts
- Segment by interests

## Open Tracking Dashboard

### Way 1: Via Project Monitoring

1. Go to **Projects**
2. Open your project
3. Switch to **"Monitoring"** tab
4. Select your press release

[Screenshot: Monitoring tab in project]

### Way 2: Via Analytics

1. Click **"Analytics"** in sidebar
2. Choose **"Monitoring"**
3. Select your press release from list

### Way 3: Directly After Distribution

After distribution, you're automatically redirected to monitoring dashboard.

## Understanding Distribution Status

The monitoring dashboard shows you a distribution overview:

### Status Overview

```
Distribution Status

ğŸ“§ 142 emails sent
âœ… 140 delivered (98.6%)
ğŸ‘ï¸ 42 opened (30%)
ğŸ–±ï¸ 12 clicked (8.6%)
âŒ 2 undeliverable (1.4%)
ğŸš« 0 unsubscribed (0%)
```

[Screenshot: Distribution status overview]

### Status Meanings

| Symbol | Status | Meaning |
|--------|--------|----------|
| ğŸ“§ | **Sent** | Email handed to server |
| âœ… | **Delivered** | Email arrived in mailbox |
| ğŸ‘ï¸ | **Opened** | Recipient opened email |
| ğŸ–±ï¸ | **Clicked** | Recipient clicked link |
| âŒ | **Bounced** | Email could not be delivered |
| ğŸš« | **Unsubscribed** | Recipient unsubscribed |
| âš ï¸ | **Complained** | Marked as spam |

## Delivery Status in Detail

### 1. Pending (Queue)

**Status**: ğŸŸ¡ Yellow

**Meaning:**
- Email waiting in distribution queue
- Will be sent shortly

**Normal Duration**: 1-30 seconds

**Action**: None, distribution runs automatically

### 2. Sent

**Status**: ğŸ”µ Blue

**Meaning:**
- Email handed to recipient server
- Technical distribution successful

**But**: Email not yet in mailbox (may still be in spam filter)

**Normal Duration**: 1-10 minutes until "Delivered"

### 3. Delivered

**Status**: ğŸŸ¢ Green

**Meaning:**
- Email successfully delivered to mailbox
- Recipient can now read the email

**Goal**: > 95% delivery rate

**Note**: "Delivered" doesn't mean "Inbox" â€“ email may be in spam folder

### 4. Opened

**Status**: ğŸŸ¢ Green (with eye symbol)

**Meaning:**
- Recipient opened the email
- Tracking pixel was loaded

**Tracking Functionality:**
- An invisible 1x1 pixel image is inserted in email
- When opened, email client loads image from server
- Server registers the opening

**Limitations:**
- Only works if recipient allows images
- Apple Mail and Gmail partially block tracking
- Open rate is therefore often **underestimated** (actual opens higher)

**Goal**: 20-30% open rate for B2B PR

### 5. Clicked

**Status**: ğŸŸ¢ Green (with click symbol)

**Meaning:**
- Recipient clicked at least one link
- Shows high interest

**Tracking Functionality:**
- All links are replaced with tracking URLs
- Example: `https://celeropress.com/r/abc123`
- Redirect to actual destination
- Click is registered

**Goal**: 5-10% click rate for B2B PR

### 6. Bounced (Undeliverable)

**Status**: ğŸ”´ Red

**Meaning:**
- Email could not be delivered
- See [Bounce Types](#understanding-bounce-types) below

**Goal**: < 5% bounce rate

**Action required**: Check contacts and delete if needed

### 7. Unsubscribed

**Status**: âš« Gray

**Meaning:**
- Recipient clicked "Unsubscribe"
- Automatically excluded from future distributions

**Note**: CeleroPress respects unsubscribes automatically

**Goal**: < 2% unsubscribe rate

### 8. Complained (Spam)

**Status**: ğŸ”´ Red (with warning symbol)

**Meaning:**
- Recipient marked email as spam
- **Critical for domain reputation!**

**Action required:**
- Remove contact from CRM immediately
- Check cause (why spam marking?)

**Goal**: < 0.1% spam rate

## Recipient List in Detail

Click **"Show All Recipients"** to see the complete list.

### Recipient Table

> **Privacy**: Detailed tracking data is only stored for 90 days.

### Filter and Sort Recipients

**Filter:**

**Sort:**

**Export:**
Click **"Export"** to export list as CSV.

## Understanding Bounce Types

There are two types of bounces:

### Hard Bounce (Permanent)

**Causes:**
- âŒ Email address doesn't exist
- âŒ Domain doesn't exist
- âŒ Recipient server permanently blocks

**Example Error Messages:**
```
550 5.1.1 User unknown
550 5.1.2 Mailbox does not exist
550 5.7.1 Recipient address rejected
```

**Action:**
1. Go to **CRM â†’ People**
2. Search contact
3. Check email address
4. **Delete** email address or contact completely

**Automatic:**
CeleroPress automatically marks hard bounces and excludes them from future distributions.

### Soft Bounce (Temporary)

**Causes:**
- âš ï¸ Mailbox is full
- âš ï¸ Server temporarily unavailable
- âš ï¸ Email is too large
- âš ï¸ Spam filter blocked email

**Example Error Messages:**
```
421 4.7.0 Temporary system problem
450 4.2.2 Mailbox full
451 4.3.0 Mail server temporarily unavailable
```

**Action:**
- **Automatic Retry**: CeleroPress tries 3 times (after 1h, 6h, 24h)
- **Manual**: Contact recipient via other means (phone, LinkedIn)

**Automatic:**
After 3 failed attempts, soft bounce becomes hard bounce.

## Performance Metrics

### Delivery Rate

**Calculation:**
```
Delivery Rate = (Delivered Emails / Sent Emails) Ã— 100
```

**Example:**
```
140 delivered / 142 sent = 98.6%
```

**Rating:**
- ğŸŸ¢ **Excellent**: > 97%
- ğŸŸ¡ **Good**: 95-97%
- ğŸŸ  **Acceptable**: 90-95%
- ğŸ”´ **Poor**: < 90% â†’ Check contacts!

### Open Rate

**Calculation:**
```
Open Rate = (Opened Emails / Delivered Emails) Ã— 100
```

**Example:**
```
42 opened / 140 delivered = 30%
```

**Rating (B2B PR):**
- ğŸŸ¢ **Excellent**: > 30%
- ğŸŸ¡ **Good**: 20-30%
- ğŸŸ  **Average**: 10-20%
- ğŸ”´ **Poor**: < 10% â†’ Emails land in spam

**Note**: Open rate is often **underestimated** (tracking blockers, images disabled).

### Click Rate

**Calculation:**
```
Click Rate = (Clicked Emails / Delivered Emails) Ã— 100
```

**Example:**
```
12 clicked / 140 delivered = 8.6%
```

**Rating (B2B PR):**
- ğŸŸ¢ **Excellent**: > 10%
- ğŸŸ¡ **Good**: 5-10%
- ğŸŸ  **Average**: 2-5%
- ğŸ”´ **Poor**: < 2%

### Click-to-Open Rate (CTOR)

**Calculation:**
```
CTOR = (Clicked Emails / Opened Emails) Ã— 100
```

**Example:**
```
12 clicked / 42 opened = 28.6%
```

**Rating:**
- ğŸŸ¢ **Excellent**: > 30% (very relevant content)
- ğŸŸ¡ **Good**: 20-30%
- ğŸŸ  **Average**: 10-20%
- ğŸ”´ **Poor**: < 10% (content not relevant)

### Engagement Rate

**Calculation:**
```
Engagement = (Opened OR Clicked) / Delivered Ã— 100
```

**Example:**
```
54 interactions / 140 delivered = 38.6%
```

**Rating:**
- ğŸŸ¢ **Excellent**: > 35%
- ğŸŸ¡ **Good**: 25-35%
- ğŸŸ  **Average**: 15-25%
- ğŸ”´ **Poor**: < 15%

## Solving Common Problems

### Problem: "Open rate is very low (<5%)"

**Causes:**

1. **Emails land in spam**
   - Solution: Perform spam test (mail-tester.com)
   - Check domain authentication (SPF, DKIM)

2. **Subject is not appealing**
   - Solution: A/B testing with different subjects

3. **Wrong send time**
   - Solution: Send Tuesday-Thursday, 09:00-11:00 AM

4. **Tracking is blocked**
   - Note: Many email clients block tracking
   - Actual open rate is higher

### Problem: "Many bounces (>10%)"

**Causes:**

1. **Outdated contacts**
   - Solution: Clean up CRM database
   - Delete hard bounces

2. **Wrong email addresses**
   - Solution: Use email verification tool

3. **Domain problems**
   - Solution: Check DNS entries

### Problem: "No clicks despite opens"

**Causes:**

1. **Content not relevant**
   - Solution: Better segment audience

2. **Links not visible**
   - Solution: Emphasize call-to-action more clearly

3. **Too many links**
   - Solution: Focus on 1-2 main links

## Tips for Better Tracking

### Tip 1: Use UTM Parameters

Add UTM parameters to links to track traffic in Google Analytics:

```
https://example.com/press-release?utm_source=celeropress&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=productlaunch
```

**Benefits:**
- See in Google Analytics how much traffic comes from email
- Can measure conversions (downloads, inquiries, etc.)

### Tip 2: Segment Distribution by Engagement

Create segments based on open and click behavior:

**Highly engaged (>50% open rate):**
- Send more frequently (weekly)
- Exclusive content

**Medium engaged (20-50% open rate):**
- Send normally (every 2 weeks)
- Standard content

**Low engaged (<20% open rate):**
- Send less frequently (monthly)
- Re-engagement campaign

**Not engaged (never opened in last 6 months):**
- Remove from distribution

### Tip 3: A/B Testing for Subject Lines

Test subjects with A/B tests (premium feature):

- **Group A (50%)**: "New Study: 80% of Americans use..."
- **Group B (50%)**: "Study shows surprising user behavior"

Measure which subject has higher open rate.

### Tip 4: Monitor Domain Reputation

Regularly check your sender reputation:

**Tools:**
- [Sender Score](https://www.senderscore.org/) (0-100, >80 is good)
- [Google Postmaster Tools](https://postmaster.google.com/)
- [Microsoft SNDS](https://sendersupport.olc.protection.outlook.com/snds/)

**Warning Signs:**
- Sender Score < 70
- Spam rate > 0.3%
- High bounce rate > 5%

### Tip 5: Analyze Best Send Times

CeleroPress shows you when your recipients open emails:

```
Best send times for your contacts:

1. Tuesday, 10:00-11:00 AM (45% open rate)
2. Wednesday, 09:00-10:00 AM (42% open rate)
3. Thursday, 02:00-03:00 PM (38% open rate)
```

Use these insights for future distributions.

## Privacy and Tracking

### GDPR Compliance

**Tracking is allowed** if:
- âœ… Mentioned in your privacy policy
- âœ… Recipients can unsubscribe (unsubscribe link)
- âœ… Data is only used for legitimate purposes (success measurement)

**Storage Duration:**
- Distribution statistics: Unlimited (anonymized)
- Detailed recipient data: 90 days
- After 90 days: Only aggregated data (no personal information)

### Disable Tracking

If you don't want to use tracking:

1. Go to **Settings â†’ Email â†’ Tracking**
2. Disable:
   - â˜ Open tracking
   - â˜ Click tracking

**Note**: Without tracking, you cannot measure the success of your distributions.
